Intelligence#

LLM-powered intelligence features for paper analysis and study aids.

Summarizer#

papercutter.intelligence.summarize.Summary(content, focus, length, model, input_tokens, output_tokens)[source]#

Generated summary of a paper.

Parameters:

  • content (str)

  • focus (str | None)

  • length (str)

  • model (str)

  • input_tokens (int)

  • output_tokens (int)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.intelligence.summarize.Summarizer[source]#

Generate summaries of academic papers using LLM.

__init__(api_key=None, model=None, extractor=None)[source]#

Initialize the summarizer.

Parameters:

  • api_key (Optional[str]) – Optional API key.

  • model (Optional[str]) – Optional model to use.

  • extractor (Optional[TextExtractor]) – Optional TextExtractor instance (for dependency injection). Creates a default PdfPlumberExtractor-based extractor if not provided.

summarize(pdf_path, focus=None, length='default', pages=None)[source]#

Generate a summary of a paper.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to PDF file.

  • focus (Optional[str]) – Optional focus area (methods, results, etc.).

  • length (str) – Summary length (short, default, long).

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of pages to summarize (0-indexed).

Return type:

Summary

Returns:

Summary object.

is_available()[source]#

Check if summarization is available.

Return type:

bool

Report Generator#

papercutter.intelligence.report.BUILTIN_TEMPLATES = ['reading-group', 'referee', 'meta', 'executive']#

Built-in mutable sequence.

If no argument is given, the constructor creates a new empty list. The argument must be an iterable if specified.

papercutter.intelligence.report.Report(content, template, model, input_tokens, output_tokens)[source]#

Generated report about a paper.

Parameters:

  • content (str)

  • template (str)

  • model (str)

  • input_tokens (int)

  • output_tokens (int)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.intelligence.report.ReportGenerator[source]#

Generate structured reports about papers using LLM.

__init__(api_key=None, model=None, extractor=None)[source]#

Initialize the report generator.

Parameters:

  • api_key (Optional[str]) – Optional API key.

  • model (Optional[str]) – Optional model to use.

  • extractor (Optional[TextExtractor]) – Optional TextExtractor instance (for dependency injection). Creates a default PdfPlumberExtractor-based extractor if not provided.

generate(pdf_path, template='reading-group', custom_template=None, pages=None)[source]#

Generate a report for a paper.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to PDF file.

  • template (str) – Template name (reading-group, referee, meta, executive).

  • custom_template (Optional[Path]) – Path to custom template file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of pages to analyze (0-indexed).

Return type:

Report

Returns:

Report object.

list_templates()[source]#

List available built-in templates.

Return type:

list[str]

is_available()[source]#

Check if report generation is available.

Return type:

bool

Study Aid#

papercutter.intelligence.study.STUDY_MODES = ['summary', 'concepts', 'quiz', 'flashcards']#

Built-in mutable sequence.

If no argument is given, the constructor creates a new empty list. The argument must be an iterable if specified.

papercutter.intelligence.study.StudyMaterial(content, mode, chapter, model, input_tokens, output_tokens)[source]#

Generated study material.

Parameters:

  • content (str)

  • mode (str)

  • chapter (int | None)

  • model (str)

  • input_tokens (int)

  • output_tokens (int)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.intelligence.study.StudyAid[source]#

Generate study materials from book chapters using LLM.

__init__(api_key=None, model=None, extractor=None)[source]#

Initialize the study aid.

Parameters:

  • api_key (Optional[str]) – Optional API key.

  • model (Optional[str]) – Optional model to use.

  • extractor (Optional[TextExtractor]) – Optional TextExtractor instance (for dependency injection). Creates a default PdfPlumberExtractor-based extractor if not provided.

generate(pdf_path, mode='summary', chapter=None, pages=None)[source]#

Generate study material.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to PDF file.

  • mode (str) – Study mode (summary, concepts, quiz, flashcards).

  • chapter (Optional[int]) – Optional chapter ID to extract.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of pages (0-indexed). Used if chapter not provided.

Return type:

StudyMaterial

Returns:

StudyMaterial object.

list_modes()[source]#

List available study modes.

Return type:

list[str]

is_available()[source]#

Check if study aid is available.

Return type:

bool
